name: Embassy Suites Hotel Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed only 1 night. We had an easy check in. The Lobby was beautiful. The front desk has maps of the area. They also have sample menus of some of the restaurants. There is a small gift shop in in the lobby area. The computer is located for guests by the lobby front desk. The grounds are beautiful. Lovely plants and ponds with swans and ducks. There were baby ducks and baby swans when we were there. My husband and I had a King bed suite on the 3 rd floor. Our room entrance was actually inside the atruium. Some rooms were outside. There was a free reception in the afternoon from 5:30 - 7:30. There were free drinks and appetizers. We took our refreshments to the outside pond area that had table and chairs. There were some people who were smoking outside, and since we are not smokers and I am highly allergic to smoke we had to change out seats to get away from the smoke outside.There was no smoking inside. Our room was quite lovely. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Lots of choices.
reviews.title: Loved the grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inside garden where the breakfast is has real trees growing and a pond with Koi with a very nice bridge. The help there is quite nice and always asking if they can bring you coffee or take away your dirty plates. If you don't want to go out to dinner there is a restaurant on the premises. If you want to swim there is an outside pool as well as an inside pool with a spa. We paid $104 a night, a government rate. We would absolutely stay here again!
reviews.title: Very impressed

likes.liked: — The room was very large and comfortable and the free hot breakfast was way above average for a free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Only one computer for free internet use (which is already a perk so hard to complain)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on April 5 for one night and it was $128 a night.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting Napa and then on our way to San Francisco. We arrived around midnight.
reviews.title: Never again at Embassy Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was very pretty and grand looking. It was a large room with
reviews.title: Great service at the Embassy Suites Napa!

likes.liked: — Breakfast and wine; nice room and hotel; great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I believe this was my third stay here at the Embassy Suites, Napa. This time, we were traveling with a small dog in tow.
reviews.title: Might be out last time here

likes.disliked: — Cheap B&B accomodations in closer in. Dungeon Room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, there was a man complaining VERY loudly at the front desk. They self check-in kiosk was not working, so we couldn't avoid him.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay at the Embassy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Because we booked a pet friendly room, we were relegated what apparantly used to be a storage room or broom closet. Hard, cold tile floors, low ceilings, and not a lot of elbow room. The bathroom? Ha. Microscopically small with pocket like doors.
reviews.title: This is a Hard Review

likes.liked: — The beautiful grounds and great free breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: They left dog treats on the mini bar area for the pooch, and it wasn't until after I got into them that I saw a SMALL sticker that said $7.00. I've never seen that in all the places I've traveled with my dog.
reviews.title: No air
I Loved It!
reviews.text: The good thing about the room location was that we were very near the dining area, so breakfast and cocktail hour were easily accessable. The courtyard is still gorgeous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They should name this hotel Freeway Noise Suites instead of Embassy Suites. My husband and I went to Napa for a cozy weekend and ended up sleeping in separate beds. The hotel is right off the main freeway so all the rooms with king sized beds are on the backside of the hotel, next to the freeway. You feel as if you are sleeping on the freeway. You look out your window and you see the freeway and you will be listening to it all night long. I thought we would have peace and quite amongst the vineyards in Napa, but not at this hotel you wont. After our first night of no sleep, our only option was to switch to the other side of the hotel and sleep in a double. That was quite a kabash on a romantic weekend with my husband, sleeping in separate beds.
reviews.title: Freeway Noise Suites!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice would be to stay in a quiet B&B away from the freeway and main town area. My advice is to skip this hotel and go stay in a cozy B&B in Napa. I would only recommend this hotel to business travelers who are alone and who carry earplugs!
reviews.title: 4 night stay. Great location. Great property. Feel confident...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 night 5 day stay in Napa Valley. We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. I did tons of research on Napa/Sonoma hotels and felt pretty good before I left. Feel confident
reviews.title: Loved Embassy Suites Napa.
Nice surprise
reviews.text: this hotel will not let you down. Typical to Better Embassy Suite rooms. Fantastic Service, friendly front desk and bar staff. Great courtyard with real swans! Breakfast served daily as well as the Manager's Cocktail hour (get their Sangria). Lots of variety on both.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We paid 264.00 a night, avg for Napa. I travel quite a bit with work and stay at 4 and 5 star properties, so I am picky. I would give this
reviews.title: What a stay?

likes.liked: — It's close location to the wineries
likes.disliked: — The musty smoke smell in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Normally when we stay at the Embassy in Napa - it's just ok. Nothing special - but we get enough room for the whole family, plus breakfast included - it's convenient!
reviews.title: Get the Romantic Room!

likes.liked: — The coffee grinder, large coffee pot & beans!
likes.disliked: — The LONG line for a cocktail in the evenings - w/just 1 bartender it gets a bit frustrating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time - my husband & I were able to bok a "Romantic" package, which I'd never seen at this Embassy before. The room was exceptional! Canopy bed, romantic furnishings & decor, a roomy glass shower, A COFFEE GRINDER, LARGE COFFEE POT & BEANS!!!! This was so enjoyable! Plasma tv was favorable to the hubby. We'd book the same roon in a heartbeat! We were giddy w/our choice.
reviews.title: Disappointed at the Embassy Suites

likes.disliked: — stuffy, warm, mildew smelling room and the rough sheets and towels.

reviews.title: Very Convenient
reviews.text: The water ponds w/the birds was relaxing. We lit the chiminea in the courtyard for extra heat while sipping our cocktails - - it couldn't be beat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was the best. HEAVENLY!
reviews.title: Excellent Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really expected much more from an Embassy Suites hotel. I don't usually complain much but there was just too many disappointments.
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely – great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 4 nights over the second weekend in October. The hotel was fully booked, but some rooms are not being used as they are still being renovated. If you are sensitive to paint odors, you may want to ask for a room away from areas being painted. The hotel is nicely located in Napa, an easy drive to restaurants and shops, and an easy drive to Sonoma or Napa Valley. In advance, we had requested a room away from the highway.
reviews.title: Good location, good stay overall

likes.disliked: — difficult to keep the temperature cool enough

reviews.title: Loved the Garden
reviews.text: Check-in was very efficient and the staff friendly and acccomodating overall. The bed was very comfortable and bath towels were nice and white and fluffy. However, there are no towel bars in the bathroom. The doors to the bath are sort of a french door and awkward to get around. There is a nice high counter/bar area that houses the mini-fridge and microwave. Our room had a coffee grinder and whole beans. The hotel offers a free full breakfast and cocktails in the evening (though we skipped that.) The hotel has a pleasant pond and patio area. We would stay here again the next time we go to Napa.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good Hotel for excursions in the Napa valley. Rooms are very nice, big and newly renovated with new carpets. Unfortunately the renovation is still ongoing, but has not so much disturbed us. The rooms facing to the motorway need better noise reduction. The evening reception is nice and the wines are good, but should better served always in wine glasses. One day I got the wine in paper cups. Overall quite good.
reviews.title: best hotel we've ever stayed at!

likes.liked: — double room/ bedroom w/ living room/bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel gives you soooo much for your money! Complimentary FULL b'fast every morning, internet access int he lobby, OPEN bar for 2 hrs every night w/ light snacks (veges,chips, etc.)
reviews.title: Family Friendly Hotel in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: First it is in a perfect location, equal distance from napa and sonoma so everywhere is only 20 minutes away. San Fran is 50 min. Secondly the grounds are gorgeous, immaculately kept with a peaceful pond area to eat/drink by. Thirdly the restaurant is FAB! we never left the grounds for dinner, there was no need to since the food was absolutely delicious.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I loved this place. The hotel is a beautiful Tuscan design, with lots of courtyards, gardens and terracotta tiles. We stayed in the Winter, but I bet its lovely in the summertime. Our room was a very nice layout for a family of four with a bedroom and a living room with a pullout bed, there's also a nice little bar area in the room (well this is Napa!)
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel and both were really good with great service.
reviews.title: Oddly designed, but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am already planning a trip back to this place next summer!
reviews.title: Exorbitant Rates for What You Get

likes.disliked: — Hotel Shuts Off A/C At Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed during the week for a quick trip to Napa, rates were much better then.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located off 29 and within walking distance to downtown, the train even goes near it.
reviews.title: Nice accommodations... please eat elsewhere

likes.liked: — The property was pretty and the rooms were clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Embassy Suites 17th to 22nd August 2008, we loved the place. The suites were imaculate and spacious.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms, breakfast and managers bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The grounds were lovely and very well kept, excellent pool and well tended sun loungers and towels provided.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast had a great selection and cooked to order although sometimes busy there was always plenty and you never felt rushed even at half past nine (this is when it finished Monday- Friday).
reviews.title: Met our needs for our family of 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: The managers bar was from 5.30 till 7.30 and offered good quality wines from the local area along with various other refreshments. The staff were also very helpful especially Mike who delivered excellent advice regarding the local area.
reviews.title: paper thin walls, sounds like water pouring down walls when toilet above flushes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lots of lovely restaurants in downtown Napa, Coles Chop House and its sister restaurant Celadon (at the top end) and also Alegria in the old bank building is excellent. For a more laid back informal dinner, you should try Downtown Joe's and Tuscany is also worth mentioning.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was concerned by some of the reviews had I read so I visited the hotel prior to making my reservation. I don't live that far from it (about 45 minutes) and I was meeting a great friend who was flying in from Georgia. She and I had a lot of catching up to do so I wanted to be sure our stay was up to par. It was! The staff from check in to check out were very efficicient and professional.. They were helpful and eager to make sure our stay was a pleasant one. Our third floor non smoking room (not a whiff of smoke) overlooked the pool, mill and beautiful swans. It was very relaxing and very quiet.The managers reception was very generous and the cooked to order breakfast was more than adequate. Did I mention the complimentary bottle of wine that was left in our refrigerator and the room service was to die for! I would definitely stay there again and I recommend it for all the reasons stated. Just make sure you specify the experience your hoping for.
reviews.title: Location, Location!

likes.disliked: — A little expensive but you get a lot for your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on a quick weekend get away on points. Overall the hotel matches out to the prior reviews, and was a pleasant stay. This hotel is a good example of a unique item found in the Embassy Suites chain that I have not run into elsewhere. It appears to have been single’s apartments converted into a hotel. (Arizona has several Embassies like this) This has some good & bad points, the good is the grounds as noted, but the room layout is rather strange with a full sink in the bedroom with a full bathroom right outside the bedroom. And overall I’ve found this type to always be in average shape with some parts really needing updating.
reviews.title: Good Location, Some quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furnishings were in good condition, but slightly dated and we have the brown shutter room so we got the one old, one new TV. And we had the strange dated bar/kitchen. Check in on a Saturday during the summer, expect delays getting your room as this place is busy. (Check in itself was quick) And get to breakfast early, it gets crowded by 9 AM but the staff in the kitchen is one of the fastest short order kitchens I’ve ever seen. We had a room facing one of the parking lots so noise wasn’t a problem, and overall the guests were pretty quiet when using the many outside areas for relaxing.
reviews.title: Loud, no sleep!!

likes.disliked: — noise, long wait in line for breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But to get around the area & to get to dinner, it was great. For dinner, highly suggest Julia’s Kitchen at COPIA, we got a last minute table easily and it was much more of a local’s place without the HWY 29 crowd driving up the prices & the noise. Talking to the guys at Conn Creek, it was one of their fave’s as well for a nice dinner.
reviews.title: Not really worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you can handle freeway noise in one ear all night, and the breakfast staff setting up at 4am in the other ear, then stay here.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

likes.disliked: — Teenage punks working the front desk.

description: Located in the historic town of Napa, near world- renowned wineries and home to celebrity chefs, the Embassy Suites Napa Valley is a Mediterranean style property built around an interior courtyard and millpond. A three story building, this charming property offers 205 spacious suites, two swimming pools, sauna, whirlpool, gift shop, restaurant, and lounge. Complimentary full breakfast and beverage reception make this a great choice for anyone looking for hidden value in the Napa Valley.
